meanings.definition: A game in which players try to throw rings onto a target.
meanings.sent1: During the picnic, the children enjoyed playing ringtoss in the park.
meanings.sent2: At the carnival, there was a popular ringtoss game with colorful rings.
meanings.sent3: The ringtoss game at the fair was so fun that even the adults joined in.
meanings.sent4: Her accuracy in the ringtoss game was like a sharpshooter hitting the bullseye.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the rings landing on the target in ringtoss echoed through the park.

meanings.definition: To play the game of ringtoss.
meanings.sent1: Let's ringtoss together at the party this weekend!
meanings.sent2: They decided to ringtoss after school to unwind and have fun.
meanings.sent3: He would always ringtoss with his little sister to make her laugh.
meanings.sent4: The friends planned to ringtoss at the beach during their vacation.
meanings.sent5: She would often ringtoss with her dog in the backyard for entertainment.

meanings.definition: The act of throwing rings onto a target in the game of ringtoss.
meanings.sent1: His perfect aim in ringtoss made him the champion of the game.
meanings.sent2: The key to winning ringtoss is to practice your throwing technique.
meanings.sent3: The ringtoss competition at the school fair drew a large crowd.
meanings.sent4: The ringtoss event at the charity fundraiser raised a lot of money.
meanings.sent5: The ringtoss challenge at the family reunion brought out everyone's competitive spirit.
